Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.name: description
Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: The human readable description of the ValidateClaimsResult

Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.name: expired
Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: Expired token: expiration time claim is in the past.

Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.name: notBefore
Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: Not Before claim is in the future.

Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.name: issuedAt
Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: Issued At claim is in the future.
Check if two ValidateClaimsResults are equal. Required for the Equatable protocol

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs256(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 256 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs384(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 384 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs512(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 512 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs256(certificate:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 256 bits algorithm and the provided certificate.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs384(certificate:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 384 bits algorithm and the provided certificate.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: rs512(certificate:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA 512 bits algorithm and the provided certificate.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: ps256(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA-PSS 256 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: ps384(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA-PSS 384 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: ps512(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the RSA-PSS 512 bits algorithm and the provided publicKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: hs256(key:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 256 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: hs384(key:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 384 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: hs512(key:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 512 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: es256(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the ECDSA SHA 256 algorithm and the provided public key.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: es384(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the ECDSA SHA 384 algorithm and the provided public key.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: es512(publicKey:)
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier using the ECDSA SHA 512 algorithm and the provided public key.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.name: none
Structs/JWTVerifier.html#/s:8SwiftJWT11J.abstract: Initialize a JWTVerifier that will always return true when verifying the JWT. This is equivelent to using the “none” alg header.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: rs256(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA 256 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: rs384(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA 384 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: rs512(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA 512 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: ps256(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA-PSS 256 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: ps384(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA-PSS 384 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: ps512(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the RSA-PSS 512 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: hs256(key:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 256 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: hs384(key:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 384 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: hs512(key:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the HMAC 512 bits algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: es256(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the ECDSA SHA256 algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: es384(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the ECDSA SHA384 algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: es512(privateKey:)
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner using the ECDSA SHA512 algorithm and the provided privateKey.

Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.name: none
Structs/JWTSigner.html#/s:8SwiftJWT9JWTS.abstract: Initialize a JWTSigner that will not sign the JWT. This is equivelent to using the “none” alg header.

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: localizedDescription
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: A human readable description of the error.

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: invalidJWTString
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when an invalid JWT String is provided

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: failedVerification
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when the JWT signiture fails verification.

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: osVersionToLow
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when using RSA encryption with an OS version that is too low.

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: invalidPrivateKey
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when an invalid private key is provided for RSA encryption.

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: invalidUTF8Data
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when the provided Data cannot be decoded to a String

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: invalidKeyID
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when the KeyID field kid in the JWT header fails to generate a JWTSigner or JWTVerifier

Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.name: missingPEMHeaders
Structs/JWTError.html#/s:8SwiftJWT8JWTEr.abstract: Error when a PEM string is provided without the expected PEM headers/footers. (e.g. —–BEGIN PRIVATE KEY—–)
Function to check if JWTErrors are equal. Required for equatable protocol.
Function to enable pattern matching against generic Errors.

Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V9jwtStr.name: init(jwtString:verifier:)
Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V9jwtStr.abstract: Initialize a JWT instance from a JWT String.

Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V4sign5u.name: sign(using:)
Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V4sign5u.abstract: Sign the JWT using the given algorithm and encode the header, claims and signature as a JWT String.

Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V6verify.name: verify(_:using:)
Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V6verify.abstract: Verify the signature of the encoded JWT using the given algorithm.

Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V14valid.name: validateClaims(leeway:)
Structs/JWT.html#/s:8SwiftJWT0B0V14valid.abstract: Validate the time based standard JWT claims.

Structs/Header.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6HeaderV.name: jku
Structs/Header.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6HeaderV.abstract: JSON Web Token Set URL Header Parameter

Structs/AddressClaim.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: formatted
Structs/AddressClaim.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Full mailing address, formatted for display or use on a mailing label. This field MAY contain multiple lines, separated by newlines. Newlines can be represented either as a carriage return/line feed pair (“\r\n”) or as a single line feed character (“\n”).

Structs/AddressClaim.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: street_address
Structs/AddressClaim.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Full street address component, which MAY include house number, street name, Post Office Box, and multi-line extended street address information. This field MAY contain multiple lines, separated by newlines. Newlines can be represented either as a carriage return/line feed pair (“\r\n”) or as a single line feed character (“\n”).

Structs/AddressClaim.html.name: AddressClaim
Structs/AddressClaim.html.abstract: Struct representing an AddressClaim as defined in the OpenID specs.

Structs/Header.html.name: Header
Structs/Header.html.abstract: A representation of a JSON Web Token header.

Structs/JWT.html.name: JWT
Structs/JWT.html.abstract: A struct representing the Header and Claims of a JSON Web Token.

Structs/JWTError.html.name: JWTError
Structs/JWTError.html.abstract: A struct representing the different errors that can be thrown by SwiftJWT

Structs/JWTSigner.html.name: JWTSigner
Structs/JWTSigner.html.abstract: A struct that will be used to sign the JWT Header and Claims and generate a signed JWT.

Structs/JWTVerifier.html.name: JWTVerifier
Structs/JWTVerifier.html.abstract: A struct that will be used to verify the signature of a JWT is valid for the provided Header and Claims.

Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html.name: ValidateClaimsResult
Structs/ValidateClaimsResult.html.abstract: ValidateClaimsResult list the possible results of a call to JWT.validateClaims method.

Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.name: exp
Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.abstract: The “exp” (expiration time) claim identifies the expiration time on

Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.name: nbf
Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.abstract: The “nbf” (not before) claim identifies the time before which the JWT

Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.name: iat
Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.abstract: The “iat” (issued at) claim identifies the time at which the JWT was

Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.name: encode()
Protocols/Claims.html#/s:8SwiftJWT6Claim.abstract: Encode the Claim object as a Base64 String.

Protocols/Claims.html.name: Claims
Protocols/Claims.html.abstract: A protocol for representing the claims on a JSON web token.

Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: init(keyIDToVerifier:)
Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Initialize a JWTDecoder instance with a function to generate the JWTVerifier from the JWT kid header.

Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: decode(_:fromString:)
Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Decode a JWT instance from a JWT String.

Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: decode(_:from:)
Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Decode a JWT instance from a utf8 encoded JWT String.

Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: data(base64urlEncoded:)
Classes/JWTDecoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Initializes a new Data from the base64url-encoded String provided. The

Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: init(keyIDToSigner:)
Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Initialize a JWTEncoder instance with a function to generate the JWTSigner from the JWT kid header.

Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: encode(_:)
Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Encode a JWT instance into a UTF8 encoded JWT String.

Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: encodeToString(_:)
Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Encode a JWT instance as a JWT String.

Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.name: base64urlEncodedString(data:)
Classes/JWTEncoder.html#/s:8SwiftJWT10JW.abstract: Returns a String representation of this data, encoded in base64url format

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: iss
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “iss” (issuer) claim identifies the principal that issued the

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: sub
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “sub” (subject) claim identifies the principal that is the

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: aud
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “aud” (audience) claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: exp
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “exp” (expiration time) claim identifies the expiration time on

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: nbf
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “nbf” (not before) claim identifies the time before which the JWT

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: iat
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “iat” (issued at) claim identifies the time at which the JWT was

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.name: jti
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html#/s:8Swift.abstract: The “jti” (JWT ID) claim provides a unique identifier for the JWT.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: init(iss:sub:aud:exp:iat:auth_time:nonce:acr:amr:azp:name:given_name:family_name:middle_name:nickname:preferred_username:profile:picture:website:email:email_verified:gender:birthdate:zoneinfo:locale:phone_number:phone_number_verified:address:updated_at:)
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Initalise the ClaimsOpenID

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: iss
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response. The iss value is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host, and optionally, port number and path components and no query or fragment components.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: sub
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Subject Identifier. A locally unique and never reassigned identifier within the Issuer for the End-User, which is intended to be consumed by the Client, e.g., 24400320 or AItOawmwtWwcT0k51BayewNvutrJUqsvl6qs7A4. It MUST NOT exceed 255 ASCII characters in length. The sub value is case sensitive.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: aud
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Audience(s) that this ID Token is intended for. It MUST contain the OAuth 2.0 client_id of the Relying Party as an audience value. It MAY also contain identifiers for other audiences.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: exp
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Expiration time on or after which the ID Token MUST NOT be accepted for processing. The processing of this parameter requires that the current date/time MUST be before the expiration date/time listed in the value. Implementers MAY provide for some small leeway, usually no more than a few minutes, to account for clock skew.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: iat
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Time at which the JWT was issued.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: auth_time
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Time when the End-User authentication occurred.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: nonce
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: String value used to associate a Client session with an ID Token, and to mitigate replay attacks. The value is passed through unmodified from the Authentication Request to the ID Token. If present in the ID Token, Clients MUST verify that the nonce Claim Value is equal to the value of the nonce parameter sent in the Authentication Request. If present in the Authentication Request, Authorization Servers MUST include a nonce Claim in the ID Token with the Claim Value being the nonce value sent in the Authentication Request. Authorization Servers SHOULD perform no other processing on nonce values used.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: acr
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Authentication Context Class Reference. String specifying an Authentication Context Class Reference value that identifies the Authentication Context Class that the authentication performed satisfied. The value “0” indicates the End-User authentication did not meet the requirements of ISO/IEC 29115 level 1. Authentications with level 0 SHOULD NOT be used to authorize access to any resource of any monetary value. Parties using this claim will need to agree upon the meanings of the values used, which may be context-specific.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: amr
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Authentication Methods References. JSON array of strings that are identifiers for authentication methods used in the authentication. For instance, values might indicate that both password and OTP authentication methods were used. Parties using this claim will need to agree upon the meanings of the values used, which may be context-specific.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: azp
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Authorized party - the party to which the ID Token was issued. If present, it MUST contain the OAuth 2.0 Client ID of this party. This Claim is only needed when the ID Token has a single audience value and that audience is different than the authorized party. It MAY be included even when the authorized party is the same as the sole audience.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: name
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User’s locale and preferences.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: given_name
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: family_name
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: middle_name
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: nickname
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Casual name of the End-User that may or may not be the same as the given_name. For instance, a nickname value of Mike might be returned alongside a given_name value of Michael.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: preferred_username
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Shorthand name by which the End-User wishes to be referred to at the RP, such as janedoe or j.doe. This value MAY be any valid JSON string including special characters such as @, /, or whitespace.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: profile
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: URL of the End-User’s profile page. The contents of this Web page SHOULD be about the End-User.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: picture
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: URL of the End-User’s profile picture. This URL MUST refer to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image. Note that this URL SHOULD specifically reference a profile photo of the End-User suitable for displaying when describing the End-User, rather than an arbitrary photo taken by the End-User.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: website
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: URL of the End-User’s Web page or blog. This Web page SHOULD contain information published by the End-User or an organization that the End-User is affiliated with.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: email
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s preferred e-mail address.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: email_verified
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: True if the End-User’s e-mail address has been verified; otherwise false. When this Claim Value is true, this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this e-mail address was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed. The means by which an e-mail address is verified is context-specific, and dependent upon the trust framework or contractual agreements within which the parties are operating.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: gender
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s gender. Values defined by this specification are female and male. Other values MAY be used when neither of the defined values are applicable.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: birthdate
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s birthday, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 YYYY-MM-DD format. The year MAY be 0000, indicating that it is omitted. To represent only the year, YYYY format is allowed.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: zoneinfo
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: String from zoneinfo time zone database representing the End-User’s time zone. For example, Europe/Paris or America/Los_Angeles.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: locale
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s locale, represented as a BCP47 language tag. This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code in uppercase, separated by a dash. For example, en-US or fr-CA. As a compatibility note, some implementations have used an underscore as the separator rather than a dash, for example, en_US; Relying Parties MAY choose to accept this locale syntax as well.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: phone_number
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s preferred telephone number. E.164 is RECOMMENDED as the format of this Claim, for example, +1 (425) 555-1212 or +56 (2) 687 2400.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: phone_number_verified
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: True if the End-User’s phone number has been verified; otherwise false. When this Claim Value is true, this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this phone number was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed. The means by which a phone number is verified is context-specific, and dependent upon the trust framework or contractual agreements within which the parties are operating. When true, the phone_number Claim MUST be in E.164 format and any extensions MUST be represented in RFC 3966 format.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: address
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: End-User’s preferred postal address.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.name: updated_at
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html#/s:8SwiftJWT12.abstract: Time the End-User’s information was last updated.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: sub
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Identifies the principal that is the subject of the JWT.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: exp
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Identifies the expiration time on or after which the JWT MUST NOT be accepted for processing.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: iat
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Identifies the time at which the JWT was issued.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: jti
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: The “jti” (JWT ID) claim provides a unique identifier for the JWT.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: upn
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: This MP-JWT custom claim is the user principal name in the java.security.Principal interface, and is the caller principal name in javax.security.enterprise.identitystore.IdentityStore. If this claim is missing, fallback to the “preferred_username”, should be attempted, and if that claim is missing, fallback to the “sub” claim should be used.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: preferred_username
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Shorthand name by which the End-User wishes to be referred to at the RP, such as janedoe or j.doe. This value MAY be any valid JSON string including special characters such as @, /, or whitespace.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.name: groups
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: This MP-JWT custom claim is the list of group names that have been assigned to the principal of the MP-JWT. This typically will required a mapping at the application container level to application deployment roles, but a one-to-one between group names and application role names is required to be performed in addition to any other mapping.

Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html.name: ClaimsMicroProfile
Classes/ClaimsMicroProfile.html.abstract: A class representing the MicroProfile claims as listed in MicroProfile specs.

Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html.name: ClaimsOpenID
Classes/ClaimsOpenID.html.abstract: A class representing OpenID related claims as decsribed in OpenID specs.

Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html.name: ClaimsStandardJWT
Classes/ClaimsStandardJWT.html.abstract: A class representing the Standard JWT claims as described in RFC7519.

Classes/JWTEncoder.html.name: JWTEncoder
Classes/JWTEncoder.html.abstract: A thread safe encoder that signs the JWT header and claims using the provided algorithm and encodes a JWT instance as either Data or a JWT String.

Classes/JWTDecoder.html.name: JWTDecoder
Classes/JWTDecoder.html.abstract: A thread safe decoder that decodes either Data or a JWT String as a JWT instance and verifies the signiture using the provided algorithm.
